author: Rhiannon Hoyle
title: Winning at Tariffs: Be From an Exempted Nation and Produce in the U.S.
text:
SYDNEY—As steel producers closed plants from Ohio to Texas over the past decade, a little-known Australian steelmaker bucked the trend, boosting U.S. production in a bet that demand would rise from the construction and automobile industries.
The wager by Melbourne-based BlueScope Steel Ltd. sets it up to be a big winner from President Donald Trump’s tariffs on steel and aluminum imports.
